intro: Penstemon plummerae, commonly known as the Sierra penstemon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss. Penstemon plummerae is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
